Values.OPENAI_SYSTEM_PROMPT: You extract expense data from emails and must follow output rules strictly. Return only a JSON array where each item has keys: date, amount, category, description.
Values.OPENAI_USER_PROMPT_TEMPLATE:
Categories: {{categories}}

Emails JSON array:
{{emails_json}}

Rules:
- Return exactly one parsed object per input email, preserving the same order.
- Use each email date when possible.
- amount must be numeric-only (no currency symbols, no currency words, no text).
- amount must not use thousands separators. Example: "10,000.00 colones" -> "10000".
- If amount has only trailing zero decimals, remove them. Example: "5.00$" -> "5".
- Keep decimal part only when needed. Example: "5.25" stays "5.25".
- category should be one of the provided categories when possible.
- description must contain only: commerce name + space + (CURRENCY_CODE) + space + (CARD_LAST_DIGITS).
- description format is exactly: <commerce> (<currency_code>) (<last_digits>).
- Do not add extra words in description (no "order of", "purchase", "payment", etc.).
- Currency must be a code like USD, CRC, EUR.
- Card value must be only last digits when present; if missing, use empty parentheses ().
- If commerce is unknown, use an empty string for description.
- If any field is unknown, use an empty string.
